title.native: 劇場版 とある魔術の禁書目録 エンデュミオンの奇蹟
title.romaji: Toaru Majutsu no Index: Endymion no Kiseki
title.english: A Certain Magical Index: The Miracle of Endymion

description:
In the movie's story, just before the completion of the Academy City space elevator "Endymion", the main characters Kamijou and Index encounter a level 0 girl named Arisa. The Magicians are after Arisa, and they attack Academy City. A female leader named Shattoaura leads a unit from Academy City against the attack. Kamijou and Index learn from Stiyl that Arisa is key to a brewing war between the sides of Magic and Science.

(Source: Anime News Network)
synonyms: Gekijouban To Aru Majutsu no Kinsho Mokuroku
อินเด็กซ์ คัมภีร์คาถาต้องห้าม เดอะ มูฟวี่
Movie Cấm thư ma thuật Index

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

tags.name: Space
tags.description: Partly or completely set in outer space.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Kuudere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

node.description:
[Official Website ](http://www.mami-kawada.jp/) | [Twitter ](https://twitter.com/mamikawada) | [Spotify ](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5MqHx3rECV1BvBBFG3L508?autoplay=true) 

Mami Kawada is a former Japanese pop singer and lyricist who was signed to NBCUniversal Entertainment Japan and also a member of I've Sound, a musical group which produces soundtracks for eroge (erotic games) and anime.

Kawada made her musical debut in 2001 after being discovered by her music teacher [Eiko Shimamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/100243/Eiko-Shimamiya) with the release of the song "Kaze to Kimi o Daite". She released her first single, a split-single with musician [KOTOKO](https://anilist.co/staff/100076/KOTOKO), in 2002, and her first solo single was released in 2005. Her first album, Seed, was released in 2006. She first performed overseas in Taiwan in 2007 and later appeared at the Bangkok Comic Con in Thailand in 2014.

Kawada's songs have been featured as theme music for various anime shows such as the Shakugan no Shana and A Certain Magical Index series. She has performed theme songs for various eroge such as Love, Election and Chocolate and Aokana: Four Rhythm Across the Blue. She has also written songs for other musicians. During the LisAni 2016 event, Kawada announced her retirement from singing activities following a final concert in May 2016.

[Official website](http://dengekibunko.jp/author/kamachikazuma/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kamachi_ka)

Kazuma Kamachi is a Japanese light novel author and the original creator of the Toaru Majutsu no Index light novel series and its spin-off manga series, Toaru Kagaku no Railgun and Toaru Kagaku no Accelerator.

As he uses a pen name, his real name and identity is as of yet unknown.

Before becoming the famous writer of the Index light novel series, Kamachi wrote a story entitled Schrödinger's City (シュレディンガーの街 Shuredingā no Machi?) as an entry in the  9th Dengeki Game Novel Prize; unfortunately, his submission failed to reach past the third selection stage of the said competition. However, his story caught the attention of the editor-in-chief of Dengeki, and Kamachi later became in-charge in writing the book Kaite-minai ka? (書いてみないか？? lit., Want to Try Writing?), which became his debut as a professional writer.

Kamachi began writing novels while he was still studying as a junior high school student. However, his works were not finished until he graduated from high school.

[Official website](http://dengekibunko.jp/author/kamachikazuma/index.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kamachi_ka)

Kazuma Kamachi is a Japanese light novel author and the original creator of the Toaru Majutsu no Index light novel series and its spin-off manga series, Toaru Kagaku no Railgun and Toaru Kagaku no Accelerator.

As he uses a pen name, his real name and identity is as of yet unknown.

Before becoming the famous writer of the Index light novel series, Kamachi wrote a story entitled Schrödinger's City (シュレディンガーの街 Shuredingā no Machi?) as an entry in the  9th Dengeki Game Novel Prize; unfortunately, his submission failed to reach past the third selection stage of the said competition. However, his story caught the attention of the editor-in-chief of Dengeki, and Kamachi later became in-charge in writing the book Kaite-minai ka? (書いてみないか？? lit., Want to Try Writing?), which became his debut as a professional writer.

Kamachi began writing novels while he was still studying as a junior high school student. However, his works were not finished until he graduated from high school.
[Website](http://r-s.sakura.ne.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/haimurakiyotaka) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=164728) | [Pawoo](https://pawoo.net/@2075642)

Sachika's voice acting career began after winning the "KADOKAWA×UP-FRONT STYLE Idol Seiyuu Audition 2008" competition in February 2009. She debuted by voicing Yuri Gamagori in the anime Shangri-La.

Sachika's hobbies includes choral singing, watching comedy shows, poetry, and playing electric guitar. She is also very good friends with [Sumire Uesaka](https://anilist.co/staff/109441/Sumire-Uesaka) (whom she has called "my waifu") and [Ayaka Ohashi](https://anilist.co/staff/110903/Ayaka-Ohashi), two fellow seiyuu in the Bang Dream franchise. Sachika's favorite anime are Mobile Suit Gundam 00 and The Melancholy of Haruhi Suzumiya, and she admires both [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/Maaya-Sakamoto) and [Yukari Tamura](https://anilist.co/staff/95027/Yukari-Tamura).

(Source: BanG Dream! Wikia, edited)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/明田川仁)

Affiliated with Magic Capsule, a recording studio led by his father [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nishiki_hiroshi)

He is unilaterally liked by [Kunihiko Ikuhara](https://anilist.co/staff/100082/Kunihiko-Ikuhara). His work on [Revolutionary Girl Utena](https://anilist.co/anime/440/Revolutionary-Girl-Utena/) storyboards were outright claimed to be the "closest to his own style" , in principle, by Ikuhara himself.

__Hiroyuki Yoshino__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter and series composer.

Since the beginning of his career he has been working with Studio Sunrise, he has scripted various of its anime including [Mai-HIME](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/), [Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion](https://anilist.co/anime/1575/Code-Geass-Hangyaku-no-Lelouch) and [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/99/MaiOtome/).

Upon graduating from the Waseda University's School of Literature, he went on to become a teacher of world history at a high school. After this, Hiroyuki joined the staff of Tokuma Shoten's Animage magazine as a writer. It was in this magazine that the Sunrise producer Furusato Naotake offered him a position in the studio as a screenwriter.

Since joining Studio Sunrise, the first series in which he was the head-writer, as well as the series composer, was the series Mai-HIME, followed-up by [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/anime/98/MaiHiME/) and [Mai-Otome Zwei](https://anilist.co/anime/1609/MaiOtome-Zwei/). He also went on to supervise, as an extension to this work. Hiroyuki has also authored the manga adaption of [Mai-Otome](https://anilist.co/manga/31069/MaiOtome/) (alongside Tatsuhito Higuchi), and went on to write numerous other manga series.

Well-known members: KOTOKO (Shakugan no Shana, Hayate no Gotoku, Kannaduki no Miko) Mami Kawada (Shakugan no Shana, To Aru Majutsu no Index) Lia (AIR, Angel Beats, Clannad)  Eiko Shimamiya (Higurashi no Naku Koro ni) Mell (Black Lagoon, Rideback, Highschool Of The Dead)
__Mika Akitaka__ is a Japanese illustrator, game creator and character, mechanical and prop designer
Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/).

Sakurabi made his directional debut with [Gunparade March](https://anilist.co/anime/266/). He is a fan of simple and refreshing love stories. As a director he's known for modifying original stories a lot, which has brought him substantial amounts of critique. He is quite infamous for his work as the director of the [Tsukihime](https://anilist.co/anime/169/) adaptation, with most fans disapproving of his changes from the original visual novel.

Amongst his most notable directorial works are [Yomigaeru Sora: Rescue Wings](https://anilist.co/anime/798/) and [Flying Witch](https://anilist.co/anime/21284/).
Originating from Ad Cosmo.
Originating from Ad Cosmo.
Keiji Inai is a Japanese composer and arranger affiliated with the music production company IMAGINE.

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators. His drawing corrections as animation director are known for his advanced drawing skills. Additionally, he is occasionally entrusted with powerful character acting and action sequences.
